analyzed: @219a ` // so sor 'brang ma'i sgrub thabs bzhugs /
translated: The Sādhana of the Great Amulet

original: # // so sor 'brang ma chen mo la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: # // so sor 'brang ma chen mo la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Homage to the Great Amulet!

original: sngar bstan ba'i cho gas stong ba nyid bsgoms pa'i rdzas la /
analyzed: sngar bstan ba'i cho gas stong ba nyid bsgoms pa'i rdzas la /
translated: As previously taught, meditate on emptiness.

original: aa las skyes pa'i zla ba'i dkyil 'khor du yi ge pram ser po 'od zer sna tshogs las sems can gyi don byed pa ste /
analyzed: aa las skyes pa'i zla ba'i dkyil 'khor du yi ge pram ser po 'od zer sna tshogs las sems can gyi don byed pa ste /
translated: From a arises a moon maṇḍala, upon which is a yellow syllable pram, which emits various light rays that perform the benefit of sentient beings.

original: de yongs su gyur pa las skad cig gis bcom ldan 'das ma chen mo so sor 'brang mar bdag nyid bskyed bar bya'o ;
analyzed: de yongs su gyur pa las skad cig gis bcom ldan 'das ma chen mo so sor 'brang mar bdag nyid bskyed bar bya'o ;
translated: That completely transforms into oneself as the Bhagavatī Mahāmāyūrī in an instant.

original: / mdog ser mo zhal bzhi pa spyan gsum pa /
analyzed: / mdog ser mo zhal bzhi pa spyan gsum pa /
translated: She is yellow, with four faces and three eyes.

original: phyag brgyad pa ste /
analyzed: phyag brgyad pa ste /
translated: She has eight arms.

original: zhal dang po ser po dang / g-yas pa dkar pa /
analyzed: zhal dang po ser po dang / g-yas pa dkar pa /
translated: The first face is yellow, the right face is white,

original: rgyab sngo ba /
analyzed: rgyab sngo ba /
translated: the rear face is blue,

original: g-yon dmar po /
analyzed: g-yon dmar po /
translated: and the left face is red.

original: g-yas kyi phyag rnams kyis ral gri dang / 'khor lo dang / rtse gsum dang / mda' rnams dang / g-yon gyi phyag rnams kyis gzhu dang / zhags pa dang / dgra sta dang / rdo rje rnams 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: g-yas kyi phyag rnams kyis ral gri dang / 'khor lo dang / rtse gsum dang / mda' rnams dang / g-yon gyi phyag rnams kyis gzhu dang / zhags pa dang / dgra sta dang / rdo rje rnams 'dzin pa'o //
translated: The right hands hold a sword, a discus, a trident, and an arrow; the left hands hold a bow, a noose, an axe, and a vajra.

original: sna tshogs padma zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi gdan la rol pas bzhugs pa /
analyzed: sna tshogs padma zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi gdan la rol pas bzhugs pa /
translated: He stands in the posture known as “dancing,” on a seat of a multicolored lotus and a moon disk.

original: 'od zer dmar po'i dkyil 'khor can /
analyzed: 'od zer dmar po'i dkyil 'khor can /
translated: He has a halo of red light.

original: rgyan thams cad kyis brgyan pa /
analyzed: rgyan thams cad kyis brgyan pa /
translated: He is adorned with all the ornaments.

original: gos sna tshogs kyi na bza' bsnams pa /
analyzed: gos sna tshogs kyi na bza' bsnams pa /
translated: He wears a variegated garment.

original: shing nga dpung chad dang / rin po che sna tshogs kyi dbu rgyan can /
analyzed: shing nga dpung chad dang / rin po che sna tshogs kyi dbu rgyan can /
translated: He has a crown of hair hanging down and a crown of various jewels.

original: 'di ltar bsams la /
analyzed: 'di ltar bsams la /
translated: Having contemplated in this way,

original: sku dang gsung dang thugs rnams kyi zla ba'i dkyil 'khor la /
analyzed: sku dang gsung dang thugs rnams kyi zla ba'i dkyil 'khor la /
translated: on the moon disks of body, speech, and mind,

original: aom a'a: h'um dkar po dang / dmar po dang / sngon po'i yi ge gsum bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: aom a'a: h'um dkar po dang / dmar po dang / sngon po'i yi ge gsum bsam par bya'o //
translated: one should imagine the three syllables, white, red, and blue: om, ah, hum.

original: de nas nu ma'i dbus su zla ba la gnas pa'i yi ge pram bsams nas /
analyzed: de nas nu ma'i dbus su zla ba la gnas pa'i yi ge pram bsams nas /
translated: Then, in the middle of the breasts, on a moon, one should imagine the syllable pram.

original: sna tshogs pa'i lha mo rnams kyis bdag nyid mchod par bsam sa te /
analyzed: sna tshogs pa'i lha mo rnams kyis bdag nyid mchod par bsam sa te /
translated: One should imagine that one is worshipped by various goddesses.

original: ji srid du ngal bar ma gyur ba de srid du spro bas bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: ji srid du ngal bar ma gyur ba de srid du spro bas bsgom par bya'o //
translated: One should meditate with enthusiasm as long as one does not become tired.

original: ngal bar gyur na rang gi snying ga'i zla ba la sngags mu tig gi phreng ba'i tshul du bzlas par bya'o //
analyzed: ngal bar gyur na rang gi snying ga'i zla ba la sngags mu tig gi phreng ba'i tshul du bzlas par bya'o //
translated: When one becomes tired, one should recite the mantra on the moon at one's heart in the manner of a rosary of pearls.

original: aom na ni dha ri @219b badzra ma h'a pra ti s'a re h'um h'um phat phat sv'a h'a /
analyzed: aom na ni dha ri @219b badzra ma h'a pra ti s'a re h'um h'um phat phat sv'a h'a /
translated: Oṃ nīladhari vajra mahāpratisarā hūṃ hūṃ phaṭ phaṭ svāhā.

original: zhes ba ni sngags so //
analyzed: zhes ba ni sngags so //
translated: This is the mantra.

original: so sor 'brang ma'i sgrub thabs rdzogs so//
analyzed: so sor 'brang ma'i sgrub thabs rdzogs so//
translated: The sādhana of Prati Sarasvatī is complete.
